means: （尤指因年岁大了而）干瘦的，干瘪的

sentence.Network_en: A wizened little man wriggled through the line of soldiers standing guard.
sentence.Network_cn: 有个一身干瘪的小个子男人,拐弯抹角混过了执行警戒的士兵队列.

sentence.Network_en: She complained of a headache, and she looked old and wizened.
sentence.Network_cn: 她说她头疼, 看上去显得又衰老又干巴.

list.abs: do wolde mich ein ungetan 却遇上了一个粗暴的恶棍  ibi deflorare 蹂躏了我的蓓蕾  Er nam mich bi der wizen hant 他抓住我贞洁的小手  sed non.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: past participle of archaic wizen 'shrivel', of Germanic origin

entry.def: A wizened person is old and has a lot of lines on their skin.

example.ex: ...a little wizened old fellow with no teeth.
example.tran: 掉光了牙齿的干瘪小老头

means.word_mean: 1. lean and wrinkled by shrinkage as from age or illness;

sentences.sentence: "a lanky scarecrow of a man with withered face and lantern jaws"-W.F.Starkie
"he did well despite his withered arm"
"a wizened little man with frizzy gray hair"

auth_sentence.content: Seated at the next table is a wizened old man who looks as Swiss as Toblerone.
auth_sentence.res_content: Seated at the next table is a wizened old man who looks as Swiss as Toblerone.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Seated at the next table is a wizened old man who looks as Swiss as Toblerone.
